pullRequest.title: Issue 5384: Add Controller APIs to Create, Update and Delete Reader Groups
pullRequest.bodyText:
Change log description
This PR has the following code changes:


Remove the addSubscriber() and deleteSubscriber() APIs from Controller.


Add 4 new APIs to Controller:
a. createReaderGroup(String scope, String rgName, RGConfig rgConfig)
b. deleteReaderGroup(String scope, String rgName) and
c. updateReaderGroup(String scope, String rgName, RGConfig rgConfig)
d. getReaderGroupConfig(String scope, String rgName)


If the ReaderGroup being created is a "Subscriber" reader group, then corresponding StreamMetadata would also be updated with subscriber entries in the create/update/delete API.


Create a new RGMetadataTable to keep track of ReaderGroups in a Pravega Cluster.


Purpose of the change
Fixes #5384
How to verify it
All Unit and Integration Tests should pass

nodes.bodyText: shouldnt add subscriber include generation number?

this will only create the metadata for the rg stream.. it is not creating the segments..
i suggest you invoke createRg stream method on streamMetadataTasks to do this.
also since create for the RG stream can also come from the users, so there can be locking contentions for creation of the stream. but its not a problem per se except that this event's processing can be delayed until the stream gets created outside this context.
however, older clients will continue to create RG streams directly.. newer clients create rg streams using the new createRG api.
so there shouldnt be a real contention of the sort.

do remember, our event processor has at least once processing guarantees. so the events can be replayed.
which means the delete rg can be replayed.
we do want to make its processing idempotent and not perform an unwanted delete in a subsequent replay of the event.
so this delete event should include the "generation" or starting segmentsegmentnumber of the RG to be deleted. so that when it is processed we only delete the intended RG.. if it was already deleted previously and the current RG has a higher generation number then we ignore this event and do nothing.
again the delete subscriber should pass the generation number so that unsubscription is also conditional and we do not unnecessarily remove a subscription unintendedly.

again this is merely updating the metadata and not deleting the actual stream..
use streammetadatatasks.deletestream to actually delete the stream.
the caveat there is that this stream will be deleted asynchronously and this processing will wait on that to complete.. i dont particularly like that pattern.
for that reason it may be preferrable to delete the RG stream outside the context of the event processing.. and then posting the event to perform unsubscriptions.

nodes.bodyText: same here. otherwise open a github issue and reference it here with the TODO message.

i would prefer if we moved this call out of event processor.. the problem is it can lead to deadlocks.. one event processing waiting on another asynchronous processing and there may not be sufficient processing slots available to process the new one as the current request holds onto a processing slot.
that is why i prefer that we create the RG stream and then submit the createRG event to be processed which simply manages the subscriptions.
PS: i know that presently create stream is performed using task framework.
an alternative here is to call createStreamBody however, that does not guarantee the mutual exclusion.
also I am ok if you open a separate github issue for this and address it immediately after we close this PR.

same comment as with create RG... again we can handle this in a separate PR.. or if we move RG creation to a separate event processor in future then it doesnt contest for the processing slots to be available (remember: each instantiation of concurrent event processor processes at most 1000 events concurrently per controller instance)..
shouldnt generation be included in deleteSubscriber too? we dont want to be deleting an unintended subscriber just because this event got replayed.

doesnt it also need "add streams" ?
updateRG can have new streams added and some old streams removed.

nodes.bodyText: please open an issue to return generation back from controller.

the guarantee of eventhelper.addIndexAndSubmitTask is for one update.
a failing over of this will simply post the event. it doesnt have the inputs for the future.
so if you actually do have intent to do multiple updates, they should be done as part of event processing and not here.
here we should just to do the fist step, start the operation and then post the event for it which will perform the whole execution if the processing has been started.
here you are doing  updateReaderGroupVersionedState followed by sealStream which in itself does a bunch of things.
i suggest you move seal stream inside the event processing. but that is a different beast all together. but we have a new issue to take one async processing waiting on another out of the workflow.. we will handle that later. for now, simply move this there.

this is suboptimal as copyOf will make another pass.. better idea is to create an ImmutableSetBuilder.
then do foreach on each element and those that dont satisfy the filter predicate, add them to the builder.

should we pass the rg UUID to delete RG method and to a conditonal delete just to be extra safe? i know you check the rg id before processing the event. and the create is also linearized on this processor so they do not race per se. but still a conditional delete may be a safer thing to do. perhaps open a github issue to address this. thanks
